text: I've just received a call from Secretary
Clinton nobody disputes that Donald
Trump won the US presidential election
but what's under scrutiny now is the
extent to which social media sites were
manipulated in order to sway the minds
of American voters Russian President
Vladimir Putin denies his country has
done anything but Facebook said it found
evidence that hundreds of accounts
controlled by so-called troll farms
backed by the Kremlin worth filling the
newsfeed of everyday Americans with
inflammatory messages on key political
talking points similar tactics were seen
being used on Twitter as well
the Russians are said to have used the
company's advertising services to target
misinformation at users in parts of the
country where the presidential race was
especially tight Google conducted its
own investigation and discovered that
thousands of dollars had been spent by
Russian link groups on search
advertisements the company is also
looking into activity on YouTube another
potential platform for Miss information
tools real-time the social networks are
now being summoned to Capitol Hill to
defend themselves Google Facebook and
Twitter will appear in front of several
committees including the Senate's
wide-reaching
investigation into Russian meddling in
the American democratic process away
from the public eye the committee has
already spoken to some of the tech
companies but was less than impressed at
what it heard presentation the Twitter
team made to the Senate Intel staff
today was deeply
one person who does not feel the issue
is worth talking about at all his
president Trump himself what the tech
companies are really afraid of is more
regulation several high-profile
politicians have drawn up what they call
the honest and act
it's a proposed law that would demand
more transparency and greater
restriction on online advertising the
companies would rather regulate
themselves and so have been trying their
hardest to show they are taking the
situation seriously twitter has
introduced a new ad policy and banned
two major Russian media organisations
from advertising of the platform and
Facebook has said it would make it clear
who is buying ads and for what purpose I
care deeply about the democratic process
and protecting its integrity but that
isn't all the tech companies of doing to
try and gain influence in the capital
between July and September this year
Apple Amazon Google Facebook and
Microsoft between them spent 14 million
dollars lobbying politicians in
Washington
